SCENE 1. EXT. CITY STREET. NIGHT
FX: BUSTLING CITY STREETS LATE AT NIGHT. EARLY 21°* CENTURY. A
LOUD, PIERCING SCREAM IN THE DISTANCE. WE GO IN CLOSE ON IT...
(FINISHING SCREAMING) ..and that’s how the drowning witch’s howl went, ladies and gentlemen. (SMILES)
LAUGHTER AND APPLAUSE FROM A CROWD OF ABOUT A DOZEN
And, when they next looked, she had vanished and was Never. Seen. Again. Now, follow me to the Gates of Hell. It’s past the kebab van. (TO BAB VAN OWNER) Evening Bill.
Leanne. Evening ladies and gents.
FX: LEADING A GROUP OF ABOUT A DOZEN PEOPLE ALONG A STREET,
AND ROUND A CORNER.
When we get back from the Catacombs, Bill does a lovely jacket potato. Now — have I got all of you? Yes, now where are my lovely Japanese tourists?
FX: SHE COMES TO A HALT.

(COUNTING SOFTLY) .. 8... 9.. 10... and, (SPEAKING TO SOMEONE WE CAN'T HEAR) not now. No, shut up. Shut up. Go away. (LOUDER, TO HER GROUP AGAIN.) Ah yes, I’ve got all twelve of you. Wouldn’t want to lose anyone in the catacombs would I?
POLITE LAUGHTER

Now, everyone, I would ask you to be brave. We’re going to venture into the Catacombs — sealed underneath the city since the 17 Century. And (PAUSE. SHE’S LISTENING TO SOMETHING WE CAN’T HEAR AGAIN) No. (BACK TO HER GROUP) Where was I? Ah yes. Only our Ghost Tour gets to see inside the Catacombs. So I will beg you all not to spoil the secret for anyone who went on an inferior tour.
FX: AS IF ON CUE, THE SOUND OF A WALKING STICK AND WITH A
SWISH OF CAPE, LOUIE ENTERS
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 3
What have we here? Ah, my poor dear Leanne!
(TIGHT) Louie.

Ladies and gentlemen! I behold the poor victims of Miss Leanne’s Ghost Tour. I beg you to turn back — not because what you'll see is frightening, but fraudulent. There are no ghosts down there — why, it’s only an old beer cellar. If you would care to come with me, I will offer you a discount on Magister Louie’s Magnificent Ghosts. Turn back — nothing awaits you down there. Merely disappointment.
MUTTERING of the “Ooh, I don’t know” variety
(HISSING) Stop poaching, Louie. (LOUD) Ladies and gentlemen, come with me. I assure you, the Catacombs are genuine.
FX: OPENS A SOLID WOODEN DOOR, TURNS ON A LIGHT SWITCH. THE
GROUP TROOP INSIDE
Come along, inside, that’s right. Into the city’s only genuine Haunted Catacombs. Come along — mind that low ceiling, sir. You are tall, ha ha. Come along. (PAUSE — LISTENING AGAIN,
HISS) Leave me alone!
(TO LEANNE) I say!
Not you. (TO GROUP) There we are. I’1l shut the door and lead the way.
(CALLING OUT) I almost forgot — they say Leanne’s hearing voices!
FX: SLAM OF HEAVY DOOR.
(SOFT) Crazy bat.
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 4
SCENE 2. INT. CATACOMBS. 21*°* CENTURY.
FX: A GROUP GOING DOWN STONE STEPS. GUTTERING CANDLES.
(TOUR MODE) Hold onto the handrail, that’s right. Now has anyone heard the story of how these catacombs were discovered?
PAUSE) Anyone? (TO THE VOICE) Not you. (BACK TO THE GROUP

No? No-one. Well, the chamber we’ve passed through used to be the living room of a student house. And one night, students being students, they decided to play with a Ouija board. I’1l tell you the full, baffling events of that night later, but for the moment, let’s just say that they discovered that their house had a basement. And what a basement! A series of blocked up passages, running under the entire street.
FX: WE COME OUT INTO A LONG CORRIDOR.
DELIGHTED MUTTERING
Spooky, yes? Look to your left. See these vaults? They were originally store rooms for the merchants who lived above but... (TO THE VOICE) No, they really were, shut up.
MILDLY AFFRONTED MUTTERING

But at some point, they were abandoned, as the shops became houses. But not abandoned entirely. Some of the vaults have been bricked up, but others were pressed into sinister use. You see this one here on the left? Look, but, I beg you, don’t go inside.
EXCITED MUTTERING
When the catacombs were uncovered this chamber was found. It
had been put to (DRAMATIC FLOURISH) Sinister Purpose. We call it “The Temple”. See the carvings on the wall? What can they mean? Madam, do you know?
(“Well no I don’t,” “Satanism?” “I hope she’s not picking on me, I’m shy” MUTTERING)
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 5

No-one knows. Professors have been around and no-one, no-one can read them. (SIGHS, SOFT, TO THE VOICE ONLY SHE CAN HEAR) No, don’t tell me what they say. (BRIGHT) And then, of course, there are these little stones, all in a circle. Now, what do you think they are, eh?
Stools?
Very good, sir. No. And please, don’t go near them. They are... a little like Stonehenge, aren’t they? And it is said
that terrible things happen if you venture inside the circle. Terrible. (THEATRE) But don’t take my word for it. Be my guest.
NERVOUS LAUGHTER

We can only guess that something was worshipped down here. Something evil. And that is why the Catacombs were sealed. But that is not the only unusual thing down here. You asked for a ghost tour. I’ll give you one. (PAUSE) Look at the end of the corridor. Those three steps. Yes?
MUTTERING OF AGREEMENT
Stay looking at those steps. I’m going to ask you to be brave. I’m going to turn off the electric lights. And I’m going to take this candle — an ordinary candle, (SHOWING IT TO ONE OF
GROUP) would you agree sir?
2: Yes.
Very good. You’re an expert on candles.
FX: SHE TURNS OFF LIGHTS. TAKES CANDLE FROM PLINTH.
Now, stay standing terribly still. And watch the wall as I walk towards it. The shadows. Watch the shadows
GASPS.
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss
1: That figure!
2: How did you do that?
FX: THAT IRRITATING SIMULATED SHUTTER NOISE MADE BY DIGITAL
CAMERAS.

(STERN) No pictures. No. But you all see it, yes? A shadow of a man, standing at the top of the steps. And yet, look around. Is there anyone here casting the shadow? No. We call him The Patient Man. (DRAMATIC PAUSE) It's an optical illusion. Clearly. (SMILES) Because, after all, there is no such thing as ghosts.
GOOD-HUMOURED LAUGHTER.
FX. A BOOMING SOUND ECHOES THROUGH THE CATACOMBS.
GASPS
1: What was that?
2: Just traffic. That’s all.
FX: MORE BOOMS. AND TRICKLING DUST.
(DISTORTED, UNRECOGNISABLE, HOWLING NOISE. HE'S TRYING TO
BUT ALL THAT'S HAPPENING IS THIS AWFUL SOUND. )
PANIC

Something’s happening. I’1ll lead you to the entrance. (TO THE VOICE) Leave us alone. Not now! (TO GROUP) The exit is this way. No, sir, no — don’t go into that chamber. Someone — please, stop him. Keep him back from the altar.
2: This whole place is falling apart.
1: (FROM INSIDE THE TEMPLE) It’s fine in here.
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss
Get out of the temple. Please. Let’s get to the steps. Follow me. Ladies and gentlemen — and come away from the altar.
1: (DREAMY, NOT THEMSELVES) But, I have to. It’s calling to me.
FX: MORE BANGS. MORE DEBRIS AND ROCK FALL.
REAL PANIC
Everyone else, get out — all right? I’1l get him. Sir, do not step inside that circle.
1: He’s coming! He’s reaching out to you!
FX: A SUDDEN SHOVE.
(GRAPPLING) Sir! Come on, out you come, and — no!
FX: SHE IS SHOVED BACK.
RESPONSE SOUND TO BEING SHOVED
1: Sabbayoth is hungry.
What?
1: Sabbayoth is coming and he needs you.
FX: MIGHTY HOWLING BUILDING TO A CRESCENDO
No. Please. Stay out of my head. Please! Shut up!
FX: SUDDEN SILENCE
(FX NOTE: DURING ALL SCENES WITH LEANNE, THE DOCTOR HAS A
FILTER ON HIM. HE'S NOT PHYSICALLY THERE, IS, IN EFFECT, A GHOST. )
(F.) And there we are! I should be in focus now. Hello! Sorry about the theatrics. Bit confusing, but can I ask you not to panic?
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss
What! Did you cause all this?
(F.) Um. Yes.
To get my attention? What are you?
(F.) Look, this is all rather awkward. Anyway, I’m the Doctor and, look, do you by any chance believe in ghosts?
You’re kidding.
MUSIC: OPENING TITLES.
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss
SCENE 3. INT. CATACOMBS. 17th CENTURY.
FX: FOOTSTEPS. BIG DRIPPING STONE CORRIDORS.
(SIGHS) Looks like we’re stuck down here.
Catacombs, underground passageways, cellars — they'll feature heavily in my autobiography.
(LOOKING AROUND) But where are we?
Does it matter? It’s just a cave of some sort.
(FIRM) We’re on Earth.
Again? Let me guess — is this Heathrow?
Most amusing.
(GOADING) Or, perhaps, many centuries from now this will be Heathrow? Funny how we keep missing.
Adric.
The TARDIS is, well, many wonderful things. Problems only occur when you aim for a specific spot. Would be much easier if we didn’t. You know - a watched pot never boils.
But that’s silly.
Not at a quantum level.
I don’t care. Where are we? Why are we here?
FX: TARDIS EMITS A STRANGE AND AWFUL BACKWARDS GROAN.
Is that the TARDIS? Why's it making that terrible noise?
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 10
(HURT) I’ve always considered the TARDIS a she, not an it.
Fine. Why is your little pony making that racket?
FX: ANOTHER GROAN FROM THE TARDIS.
Something in our surroundings is upsetting her. We didn’t come here by accident. We answered a distress call.
Did we?
The TARDIS is very fond of them. In theory, somewhere in these, um, caverns, should be a spaceship and a friendly alien in need of help.
I get it. “Officers And Cars Respond To Urgent Calls”
Very good.
What are you talking about?
I read it on the TARDIS door.
But there isn’t a spaceship here.
Well, we haven’t found one yet. We’ll just have to explore a bit more, won’t we?
Great.
Of course, whoever sent the distress call may not actually need one.
Not all races require a spacecraft.
(GRATEFUL) Exactly! There are gateways, muon pathways, and, erm.. all sorts of things.
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 11
But what’s an alien doing in these caverns?
Looking to get out?
Asking for help. We may not have found it — but I think the
has interfaced with it.
FX: ANOTHER HOWL FROM THE TARDIS.
See? Now, Adric, Nyssa, why don’t you go over there? Tegan and I will go this way.
FX: THEY WALK OFF IN THEIR SEPARATE DIRECTIONS.
MUSIC: SEGUE.
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 12
SCENE 4. INT. CATACOMB STEPS. 17th CENTURY.
FX: FOOTSTEPS, CAREFUL CLIMBING OF STAIRS
Careful.
I am being careful.
It’s just these steps — well, they’re not very...
Regular?
FX. NYSSA STOPS.
(SIGHS) I miss Traken. (SAD PRIDE) Our staircases were very regular. I’m going back down.
FX: NYSSA GOES DOWN A FEW STEPS.
I can’t see how high they go. This torch isn’t very powerful.
FX: TAKES A FEW MORE STEPS.
Let’s go back.
Not coming up with me? If I go on, I'll leave you in the dark.
(SHIVERING, NOW SLIGHTLY OFF) It’s so cold down here.
FX: ADRIC CARRIES ON CLIMBING

Only to be expected if we are underground. Also if there are buildings on top of this, then the amount of heat permeating downwards would be minimal. Unless of course, we were a long way underground, sufficiently so as to be able to induct heat from the Earth’s core-
(OFF) Stop talking!
Charming! Sorry if I was boring [you] —
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 13
(OFF) Can’t you feel it? The cold. There’s something in the cold.
I can’t feel anything.
FX: CARRIES ON UP THE STEPS.
OFF) But there’s something, pressing in on me. (DEEP BREATH
You’re being hysterical. Come up the stairs. The Doctor told us to explore. I’m exploring. If there’s a way out, I’m going to find: 2h.
(OFF) Please. Don’t leave me in the dark.
Come up the stairs, then. (GOES UP MORE STEPS) Not much further. I can see the ceiling. And, if I’m right, there should be a hatch or...
Oh.
OFF. GASPS
What now?
(OFF, SOFT) The Doctor was right.
What about?
Well, I’ve bad news. There’s no way out. We’re sealed in. The entrance has been blocked. Anyway, what were you saying? What’s the Doctor right about?
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss
(OFF) We’re trapped. And there is something in here with us. can feel it in my mind. And Adric? (LOUD, PANICKED) It’s coming for you.
FX: SUDDEN HOWLING SHRIEK
(DISTORTED) Sabbayoth!
FX: SOMETHING SWOOPS TOWARDS ADRIC.
What? (FALLS) Arg!
I
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 15
SCENE 5. INT. TEMPLE CHAMBER. 17th CENTURY.
FX: THE DOCTOR AND TEGAN EXPLORING.
You could have brought another torch.
There are plenty more in the TARDIS... somewhere. (CHANGING THE SUBJECT) I wonder if this place is some kind of temple. See — there’s even a stone circle.
The mini Stonehenge?
Crudely, yes. And the markings on this wall are fascinating.
Uh-huh. That’s one word for them. Seriously, have you never seen a Peter Cushing film?
(HE HAS) Well...
Someone has drawn with blood all over the walls. It is blood isn’t it?
Appears to be, yes. (CONSIDERING) Whatever these markings are... I can’t decipher them. They’re ancient. Which is odd as...
FX: DABS FINGER, LICKS IT.
DISGUSTED NOISE
(SMACKS LIPS) The blood is relatively new. And tastes of chicken. Not human. So there’s something.
But look at this place — it’s a temple isn’t it? A temple with blood on the walls. It’s not going to be good, is it?

Well, not necessarily. The thing is, trapped aliens are apt to be — ah — misconstrued by the local, more primitive populations. Killed out of fear. It’s even trickier if they use mental projection and arrive without a body. They end up being worshipped. Which doesn’t help anyone in the end.
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 16
So there's something down here. An alien. It doesn’t have a body. People kill things for it and write sinister squiggly things on the walls and you’re suggesting we offer it a lift?
Tegan, Tegan, there’s so much life in the universe — some of it so strange, so wonderful that it translates badly into our own experience.
The dead chickens are a translation error?
Probably. “Hello” can be a surprisingly tough concept to crack.
FX: TEGAN IS WALKING AROUND THE CHAMBER. SHE STOPS WITH A WET
CRUNCH.
Doctor. Could you shine your torch over here?
In a moment, I’m just trying to get my head round [this symbol. It may be an E.]
(OVER THE END OF HIS LINE) Now.
Of course. Oh.
FX: HE TAKES A FOOTSTEP AND STOPS.
Tegan, step back.
What. Am. I. Standing. In?
Step back. That’s all. Yes. That’s right. You can look now. If you really want to.
FX: TEGAN STEPS BACK.
(LONG INTAKE OF BREATH) It’s a pile of bones. Eurgh. But they're... mushy.
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 17
(PEERING) Hmmmn. The bones are breaking down. Something’s attacking the valency of the bonds in the molecules — sucking the energy out of them like, well, marrow from a bone.
Right. So they don’t just sacrifice chickens to it. It eats them?
Chickens? Yes.
What? I mean, those are just chicken bones aren’t they?
Yes. (PAUSE) No.
Oh god.
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss
SCENE 6. INT. CATACOMB STEPS. 17th CENTURY.
(GROANING) Nyssa? Where are you?(EDGE OF PANIC) Nyssa?
FX. NYSSA'S VOICE COMES FROM A WAY OFF.
(OFF) I’m here.
Something attacked me. I lost my footing, fell down the steps.
(OFF) Are you all right?
My leg... oh, it’ll heal. How about you?
(OFF) I’m fine. Well, I assume I am. You’ve been quiet for so
long.
(EMBARRASSED) I dropped the torch.
(OFF) I heard it fall. It's probably broken.
FX: ADRIC STARTS SCRABBLING ON THE FLOOR.
I can’t find it. If only I knew where I’d fallen in relationship to the stairs then I could calculate its whereabouts.
(OFF) Really?
(CAUGHT) No. (PAUSE) Something attacked us. But it wasn’t physically there. All I felt was - cold.
(OFF) Adric...?
Just that single moment. It felt horrible.
(OFF) Adric! It’s still holding on to me. It won’t let go. can’t move.
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 19
What? Nyssa. I’m coming towards you.
FX: ADRIC TAKES LIMPING STRIDES TOWARDS NYSSA.
(OFF) It’s pushing into my head. Peculiar. On Traken, we’re aware of fear, but we try not to feel it. But this... thing. It wants me to be afraid. It’s like a hand, stroking my spine.
Is it talking to you?
(OFF) Not in a direct sense. Well, I think the Doctor’s alien has found us.
I do too.
FX: ADRIC IS NOW CLOSER TO NYSSA
We should find a way of communicating with it.
Do you think that’s wise? It’s attacked us.
It’s so alien. Perhaps it’s making me feel afraid... to tell me that it feels afraid. (SMILES BRAVELY) Yes. Maybe that’s it.
I think I’m standing next to you. Nyssa? Are you there?
Oh, come on Nyssa. Answer me.
(SHIVERING) Sorry. I was too.. frightened to speak.
I’ve got you! There! I’ve got your hand. It’s so cold. (PAUSE) You can feel me holding your hand, can’t you?
No. But then (SADLY) I don’t think you’re holding my hand.
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss
But --- (PANIC) I can’t let go! Nyssa,
I can’t let go.
Adric, it’s making me feel something else. (WORRIED,
THOUGHTFUL) Hungry.
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 21
SCENE 7. INT. CATACOMB CORRIDOR. 17th CENTURY.
FX: THE DOCTOR AND TEGAN ARE STRIDING ALONG THE CORRIDOR.

(RAPID) .. An interface between mental and atomic energy. I mean, it’s not so bizarre. You boil a kettle and that energy translates into a nice cup of tea and that makes you feel all’s right with the world and yes, that’s one way, but what we’re seeing here-
Slow down, Doctor.
I gabble when I’m nervous. Tegan, we have to find Adric and Nyssa and get them back to the TARDIS. What drew us here...
Bad news?

Yes. The force that’s become trapped down here. It’s not necessarily evil. It’s just that it is so very unlike us, and, I hate to say this, but I don’t think we’re going to get along. (SHOUTS) Nyssa! Adric! (PAUSE) Oh, where are they?
These caverns are huge. Let’s try down here.
I told them to go right.
Which is why we’re trying left.
FX: WALKING ALONG.
Aren’t you going to ask me what the creature is?
No. I’m not going to like the answer.
Very sensible. You see, what it is —
GROANS
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 22.
- is an ancient force. I think, right now, it’s very weak. But it feeds off energy. Life energy. Such as chickens.
And us?
Yes. Any form of life is energy to it. Which is why we’re getting out of here. It’s so starved that we can’t reason with it. It’1ll just devour us.
FX: TEGAN STOPS WALKING
(SOFT) Doctor, I’ve found them.
FX: THE DOCTOR AND TEGAN HURRY UP AND BEND DOWN, SLAPPING AND
YANKING AT ADRIC AND NYSSA.
They’re just lying there.
DOCTOR/TEGAN: Adric! Nyssa! Come on! Snap out of it!
. So cold.
(MUTTERING) No, please, stay back, no more!
Come on, you two, let’s sit you up. Tegan, help me move them over to the wall.
FX: THE DOCTOR AND TEGAN DRAG THEIR FRIENDS OVER TO A WALL.
& TEGAN:
EFFORT SOUNDS
That's it, there we go.
They’re freezing.
Both of you. Open your eyes. That’s right. Look at me. Can you remember your names. Yes?
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 23
Adric.
Nyssa.
Very good. Excellent.
(WEAK) Not really. Name recognition requires a really low intellectual response. Tegan?
Yes?
See?
Hey!
Doctor, can you feel the cold?
Yes. Don’t worry. We’re going to get you back to the TARDIS and you’re going to be fine.
It’s freezing here. Much colder than everywhere else. Why is that?
Because the alien’s here. All around us.
Draining the energy out of the air, of course!
It’s fed on us already. But it left us alive. Because it knew that you would come looking for us.
A GENTLE GROAN
Not good. Can you walk?
(GRUNTS) No. I can’t move my legs.
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 24
It's clever — cunning. Leaving us unable to walk to detain you here. Doctor, Tegan — leave us.
(FEAR) No! Please — take me with you — take us. I can’t stand ats
Come on — let’s (EFFORT, HEAVE) get you up — drunk passenger training. Come on, you brave soldier. Doctor, get Nyssa.
(EFFORT, LIFTING NYSSA) When it comes for us, I’1l try and communicate.
I thought you said we couldn’t talk to it.
I’d like to try.
FX. THEY START DRAGGING NYSSA AND ADRIC ALONG THE CORRIDOR.
LOUDER ROAR
(EFFORT) Can you hear me?
LONG MENACING ROAR. ENDING WITH A MILD QUESTION MARK
What’s happening?
(EFFORT) I’m reaching out to it. Thinking calm thoughts along the Vantalla scale.
UNCERTAIN RUMBLE
(EFFORT) You seem to have confused it.
(EFFORT) That’s the intention.
You can let go now, I can manage on my own.
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 25
Me too.
It projects emotions. I think that's how it communicates.
Which is why I'm projecting to it how calm I feel. (SMILES) It’s really quite nippy, isn’t it?
Doctor, you don't seem calm.
Not now, Adric.
It’s just, if you’re trying to tell it that you’re feeling calm and you’re actually not feeling cam, isn’t it going to get [confused? ]
(TERSELY, INTERRUPTING) Not now! I said, not now!
I don't think anger will help.
LONG, ANGRY HOWL
FX: THE ROAR IS SUDDENLY EVERYWHERE.
DOCTOR, TEGAN, NYSSA, ADRIC: (FEAR) Aaaaargh!
Run!
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss
SCENE 8. INT. TARDIS. 17‘" CENTURY
FX: THE INSIDE OF THE SHIP IS QUIET, HOLLOW. FROM OUTSIDE, WE
FOOTSTEPS COME RUNNING.
(MUFFLED) Come on everyone — into the TARDIS. We’1ll be safe there.
FX: A RATTLE OF A KEY, AND THEN:
(MUFFLED) It’s stuck! The key's stuck!
(MUFFLED) Now? It picks this moment to get stuck!
(MUFFLED) Nyssa! Hurry up!
(MUFFLED) It’s so hungry.
(MUFFLED) And — finally!
FX: THE LOCK CLICKS OPEN. AND THEN THE MAIN TARDIS DOORS
BUT THE DOCTOR IS HAVING TO PUSH THEM.
There's something wrong with the doors. Push! Come on,
everyone, push!
FX: AND, WITH A CREAK, THE MAIN DOORS CREAK OPEN AND THE
STEP INTO THE ECHOING DEAD, TARDIS.
What’s going on? It’s so dark in here.
OPEN,
I was afraid this might happen. Close the doors — come on.
Quickly — put your backs into it. Got to keep it out.
FX: CREAK SLAM. THE DOORS CLOSED. THEY PAUSE, PANTING, ONCE
THE DOORS ARE SHUT.
(QUIETLY) Doctor, the TARDIS is dead isn’t it?
But it can’t be!
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss 27
Well, she is.
The alien feeds on life. And the TARDIS is a living entity. Well, she was.
FX: THE DOCTOR WALKING AROUND SADLY.
(SOFT) Are you okay?
(SOFT) Not really. No.
FX: THE DOCTOR FLICKS A FEW SWITCHES, WITHOUT LUCK.
So those cries the TARDIS was making — a distress call?
Yes. (THINKS) Well, no.
So we’re trapped here?
Not now, Adric.
(RALLYING) They weren’t distress calls. She was trying to escape. The TARDIS has a defence mechanism — The Hostile Action Displacement System. HADS for short.
So, when it finds itself in danger it goes elsewhere?
It scarpers from trouble?
It’s never worked before.
FX: THE DOCTOR PULLS A PANEL OFF THE TARDIS, GRABBING CABLES.

(BUSY) Like memory it’s selective. Now — before the alien force burrowed into her, the TARDIS was trying to relocate. So there could — should — be some latent energy. I can tap into the system and effect an, um, emergency temporal shift. Nyssa, open that roundel and get me some more copper cable.
DW-MR-JAN2018- Ghost Walk by James Goss
